--- title: "4.5 — The Evolution of Modern Macroeconomics — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} # Meeting Dates *Thursday, December 2, 2022* ::: ## Overview ## Readings ### Required Readings - Finish Ch.15 "The Development of Modern Macroeconomic Thought" in Landreth & Colander ### Recommended Readings: - [ "Fear the Boom and Bust: Keynes vs. Hayek - The Original Economics Rap Battle!"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d0nERTFo-Sk) - [ "Fight of the Century: Keynes vs. Hayek - Economics Rap Battle Round Two"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GTQnarzmTOc) - [ "Game of Theories: The Keynesians," *MR University*](https://mru.org/courses/principles-economics-macroeconomics/business-cycle-theories-keynesian) - [ "Game of Theories: The Monetarists," *MR University*](https://mru.org/courses/principles-economics-macroeconomics/business-cycles-monetarists) - [ "Game of Theories: Real Business Cycles," *MR University*](https://mru.org/courses/principles-economics-macroeconomics/business-cycles-real-business-cycle) - [ "Game of Theories: The Austrians," *MR University*](https://mru.org/courses/principles-economics-macroeconomics/business-cycles-austrian-economic-theory) - [ "Game of Theories: The Great Recession," *MR University*](https://mru.org/courses/principles-economics-macroeconomics/business-cycles-great-recession) ### Questions to Help Your Reading ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats. Clicking the image will bring you to the html version of the slides in a new tab. The lower button will allow you to download a PDF version of the slides. ::: callout-tip You can type h to see a special list of viewing options, and type o for an outline view of all the slides. ::: I suggest printing the slides beforehand and using them to take additional notes in class (*not everything* is in the slides)!

Download as PDF

## Assignments ### Participation/Discussion Board Posts Due 8 PM Fri Dec 2 This week's graded discussion is worth 5 points, and can be a combination of discussion in class, and/or posts on the Blackboard Discussion Board by 8 PM this Friday December 2. ## Tournament Votes The first round of the Neoclassical division of the "Most Interesting Economist in History" tournament is live. Please post your votes in the discussion board.
